title: China readies supersonic spy drone unit, leaked document says
description: China’s cutting-edge drone could give it a surveillance advantage during a possible military confrontation over Taiwan.

title: Russian minister visits Venezuela, offers full support
description: Russia and Venezuela have reviewed some of their hundreds of bilateral agreements covering the financial, energy, agricultural and several other sectors during discussions between their top diplomats

title: Iran's top leader rules out referendums on divisive issues
description: Iran’s supreme leader has ruled out the holding of popular referendums on state policies

title: Mexico court: National Guard shift to army unconstitutional
description: Mexico’s Supreme Court ruled Tuesday that last year’s transfer of the newly created National Guard from civilian to military control was unconstitutional

title: Brazil government aims to boost safety after school attacks
description: Brazil’s government has announced efforts to spend more on securing schools and crack down on the incitement of violence as officials seek to curb a wave of fatal school attacks

title: South Sudan reports 5 deaths in hepatitis E outbreak
description: South Sudan has reported five deaths and 91 suspected cases from an outbreak of hepatitis E in the northwest of the country

title: Trapped by fighting, Sudanese look for ways to survive
description: The lives of of millions of Sudanese have been brutally disrupted since violence suddenly erupted over the weekend between forces loyal to the country’s top two generals

title: Alabama officials keep quiet on progress in birthday melee
description: Authorities with the Alabama Law Enforcement Agency on Tuesday had yet to announce any arrests in the weekend shooting in Dadeville that killed four and left 32 injured

title: French publishing manager held in UK for obstructing police
description: A Paris publisher says one of its managers has been arrested in London after being questioned by police about participating in France’s protests against pension reform

title: Tunisia detains opposition leader as crackdown escalates
description: The detention of Rachid Ghannouchi, head of the Ennahda party, is the latest and most dramatic in a wave of arrests of Tunisian President Kais Saied's critics.

title: Residents, aid workers surprised by closure of Iraqi camp
description: Iraq’s ministry of migration and displacement has announced it shut down a camp housing internally displaced Iraqis with alleged ties to the Islamic State group

title: Police say several injured in western German city gym attack
description: German police say several people have been injured in an attack at a gym in the western city of Duisburg

title: U.S. charges four Americans with aiding Kremlin efforts
description: A new indictment expands charges in an alleged Russian political influence operation in Florida and Missouri.

title: Hunger is soaring and spreading across West Africa, says UN
description: United Nations’ officials say hunger is soaring and spreading across West Africa, with a 10-year high of some 48 million people facing food insecurity in the conflict-riddled region

title: Authorities raid fashion houses in EU antitrust probe
description: Authorities in several European Union member states have raided fashion houses in an initial move linked to an EU antitrust probe

title: Press groups: Spyware again used against Mexican activists
description: Press freedom groups say the Mexican government apparently continued to use Pegasus spyware to infect the telephones of human rights activists as recently as late 2022, despite a pledge by President Andrés Manuel López Obrador to stop such spying

title: 7 soldiers hurt in military vehicle pile-up in Germany
description: German police say seven soldiers were injured when several military vehicles crashed into each other in an accident on a Bavarian highway on Monday

title: King Charles III’s coronation: What to know about the May 6 ceremonies
description: King Charles and Queen Camilla will be crowned at Westminster Abbey and parade through London in rituals that help give the British monarchy its legitimacy.

title: 21 dead in Beijing hospital fire, dozens evacuated
description: Chinese state media say 21 people have died in a fire at a Beijing hospital that forced the evacuation of dozens of patients

title: Anglican conservatives meet in Rwanda amid rift over LGBTQ
description: Hundreds of Anglican conservative leaders from 52 countries are meeting in Rwanda amid a rift over support for same-sex unions within the church

title: Irish climber dies, Indian missing on Nepal's Annapurna
description: An Irish climber has died and an Indian climber is missing after falling into a crevasse in two separate incidents on Mount Annapurna, the world’s 10th highest mountain

title: Thousands join Holocaust remembrance march at Auschwitz
description: Thousands of people have gathered at the former site of Auschwitz for the March of the Living

title: Pakistan court jails Chinese national charged with blasphemy
description: A Pakistani court has ruled that a Chinese national arrested on blasphemy charges be held in jail for two weeks, pending trial

title: An intellectual battle rages: Is the U.S. in a proxy war with Russia?
description: THE DISCORD LEAKS | Vladimir Putin says the West is trying to “finish” Russia. The Biden administration denies the accusation. But leaked documents reveal the extent of U.S. involvement in the Ukraine fight.

title: Russia rejects U.S. journalist Gershkovich’s appeal of spying arrest
description: Russia detained Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich on espionage charges, claiming without evidence that he was caught "red-handed."

title: U.S. diplomatic convoy fired on in Sudan as U.N. aid workers assaulted
description: Blinken called the attack on a U.S. convoy "reckless," as Sudan's army denied claims of a cease-fire by the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces.

title: Putin visits two occupied regions in Ukraine, pushing illegal annexation
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin made a secretive trip to areas Ukraine that he declared would be Russia's "forever" but where his troops were forced to retreat last fall.

title: United Arab Emirates, Qatar edge toward reopening embassies
description: Qatar and the United Arab Emirates are both acknowledging that they’re edging closer to reopening embassies in each others’ countries after a yearslong boycott of Doha over a political dispute

title: Sudan’s power struggle has killed nearly 200. Here’s what to know.
description: Sudan's military is fighting the Rapid Support Forces, a paramilitary group known as RSF, in a conflict unleashing violence across the country.

title: G-7 stresses unity on China following unease over Macron’s comments
description: Foreign ministers put on a unified front after French President Emmanuel Macron suggested Europe should avoid getting dragged into a confrontation over Taiwan.

title: The Yanomami are dying of malaria and malnutrition. Is it genocide?
description: Brazil's Supreme Court has launched an investigation into the Bolsonaro administration's response to the Indigenous group's pleas for help.

title: Indonesia dismisses rebel claim of army deaths in Papua
description: Indonesia’s military chief has dismissed a separatist group claim that they had killed more than a dozen government soldiers who were searching for a New Zealand pilot taken hostage by the rebels in the restive Papua region

title: Reclusive Taliban leader releases end-of-Ramadan message
description: The reclusive top leader of the Taliban has released a message lauding the changes in Afghanistan since the Taliban takeover and the measures they imposed after seizing the country following two decades of war

title: J-Hope becomes 2nd BTS member to join South Korean army
description: J-Hope, a member of K-pop sensation BTS, has entered a South Korean boot camp to start his 18-month compulsory military service

title: Michelle Yeoh seeks new challenges after Oscar win
description: Michelle Yeoh says she is looking for new challenges including as a producer, as she credited perseverance, hard work and passion for her historic Oscar win last month

title: Canada’s public broadcaster pauses Twitter over ‘government-funded’ tag
description: It is the latest conflict between Twitter, owner Elon Musk and publicly supported news outlets like NPR, PBC, the BBC and ABC in Australia.

title: Iran renews threats against Israel during Army Day parade
description: Iran’s president has reiterated threats against Israel while marking the country’s annual Army Day, though he stayed away from criticizing Saudi Arabia as Tehran seeks a détente with the kingdom

title: Israel remembers 6 million Jews killed in Holocaust
description: Israelis have ground to a halt for a nationwide moment of silence in remembrance of the 6 million Jewish victims of the Holocaust as a two-minute siren wailed across the country

title: Ukraine live briefing: Putin visits troops in Kherson region; Russia sentences top Kremlin critic to 25 years
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin visited the headquarters of his forces in Ukraine’s Luhansk and Kherson regions, the Kremlin said.

title: For Palestinians, holiest Ramadan night starts at checkpoint
description: For many Palestinians, the journey to one of Islam’s most sacred sites on the holiest night of Ramadan begins in a dust-choked, garbage-strewn maelstrom

title: Suspected shooting attack in Jerusalem wounds 2 Israeli men
description: Police say a suspected shooting attack by a Palestinian gunman in Jerusalem wounded two Israeli men

title: Putin visits Russian troops in occupied Ukraine
description: The Kremlin says Russian President Vladimir Putin has visited headquarters of the Russian troops fighting in Ukraine

title: Behind chaos in Sudan is a broader global power struggle
description: As dueling warlords remain locked in a classic internecine conflict in Sudan, outside players are fueling the discord.
